intro: Symplocos wenshanensis, commonly known as the Wenshan evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan province, where it grows in humid, mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are typically red or yellow berries, which are edible but not widely consumed by humans. Symplocos wenshanensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
